alert.note: Alert for Emery; Wayne (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 5:46PM MDT until August 21 at 8:45PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Emery County in central Utah... Northeastern Wayne County in southern Utah... * Until 845 PM MDT. * At 546 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Crack and Chute Canyons. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, dry washes, and slot canyons. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Goblin Valley. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
